data.text: @Denislim @_mbdr_ attention seekers like Megan couldn't continue to get free clout if they did that though
@_mbdr_ one thing to watch a slow train crash, another to watch many slow train crash at the same time
@Redkiraz @_mbdr_ Es gibt keine Omerta in Schweizer Medien. Es gibt einfach Menschen, die zur Frage der Maskenpflicht usw. eine andere Meinung haben.

@_mbdr_ The Omerta rule in media is killing us. For politicians it's business as usual, they need the support of lobbies so doing everything for not loosing votes. But swiss media's pushing end of pandemic tale every single day is criminal

@_mbdr_ People should really stop monitoring daily confirmed cases. It is no longer important at at the least, not the only metric to gauge the real situation on the ground. For as long as the country healthcare system is not stressed, those +ve rate or confirmed cases do not mean much

@_mbdr_ @AnneMouse4 @OurWorldInData They took down covid measures in two steps. First step at 18/2. As people knew the measures would be mostly gone the 25th, they started to act on that before the 25th.

@JohnDoomen1 @AnneMouse4 Thanks. It looks like there was an upswing that started around the 17th. I don't know why.

@OurWorldInData only has up to the 25th for some reason. Will watch to see what happens next.
